movies.title: Trucks
movies.plot: A small town truck stop is taken over by driver-less trucks. Possibly caused by a toxic spill in the city. After the trucks cause numerous deaths, the remaining survivors (two teens, their fathers, and another lady citizen) are forced to escape the truck stop. They find it's very difficult to out-smart the trucks.
movies.simplePlot: Based on the short story by Stephen King, this tells the tale of trucks suddenly coming to life and attacking their owners.

biography.bio: Timothy Busfield is a Producer, Director and Emmy Award winning actor with over 650 professional credits. As an actor he has been a series regular or recurring character in 14 series including "Thirtysomething", "The West Wing", "Entourage", "Sleepy Hollow", Secrets and Lies", "ED", "Studio 60 on the Sunset Strip", "Trapper John, M.D.", "The Byrds of Paradise", "Champs", "Family Ties", "Without A Trace", "The Paper Chase", "Reggie" and "All My Children". Timothy has appeared in over 40 television movies and feature films, including "Field of Dreams", "Stripes", "Revenge of the Nerds", "Nerds in Paradise", "Quiz Show", "Sneakers", "Striking Distance", "Little Big League", "First Kid", "National Security", "23 Blast", "Strays", "Trucks", and "One Smart Fellow" which he co-directed, co-wrote, and acted in. Timothy has directed over 125 episodes of television, including "This Is Us" and multiple episodes of "The Fosters" (also directed the pilot), "thirtysomething", "Sports Night", "Damages", "Lipstick Jungle", "Studio 60 on the Sunset Strip", "Without A Trace", "Las Vegas", "The Night Shift", "Secrets and Lies", "The Glades", and many more. Timothy has served as a Producing Director on 7 series including "Secrets and Lies", "Mind Games", Lipstick Jungle", "Studio 60 on the Sunset Strip", "Without A Trace", "ED", and the mini series "Maneater". In theatre, Timothy has appeared on Broadway twice, most recently as Lt. Daniel Kaffee in Aaron Sorkin's "A Few Good Men." Timothy founded two of America's most successful professional theaters, The Fantasy Theatre (AKA the B Street School Tour) and The B Street Theatre, both in Sacramento, California. Now in their 31st season, the theaters perform annually for over 200,000 children and adults throughout northern California. Timothy has an honorary PhD from Michigan State University and serves as an Artist in Residence and Director of National Content for their PBS affiliate WKAR. He lives with his wife, television icon and fantastic cook, Melissa Gilbert.
biography.name: Timothy Busfield

biography.bio: Brenda Bakke was born on May 15, 1963 in Klamath Falls, Oregon, USA as Brenda Jean Bakke. She is an actress, known for Hot Shots! Part Deux (1993), L.A. Confidential (1997) and Tales from the Crypt: Demon Knight (1995).
biography.name: Brenda Bakke

biography.bio: Aidan Devine was born in England. He is an actor, known for A History of Violence (2005), Suicide Squad (2016) and Outlander (2008).
biography.name: Aidan Devine

biography.bio: Roman Podhora was born in Fernie, British Columbia, Canada. He is an actor, known for Chicago (2002), K-19: The Widowmaker (2002) and Final Destination 5 (2011).
biography.name: Roman Podhora

biography.bio: Jay Brazeau was born on December 22, 1953 in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada. He is an actor and writer, known for Best in Show (2000), Insomnia (2002) and Double Jeopardy (1999).
biography.name: Jay Brazeau

biography.bio: Brendan Fletcher was born on December 15, 1981 in Comox Valley, British Columbia, Canada. He is an actor and writer, known for The Revenant (2015), Freddy vs. Jason (2003) and Tideland (2005).
biography.name: Brendan Fletcher

biography.bio: Amy Stewart is an actress, known for Ice Princess (2005), Winnipeg mon amour (2007) and Lost and Delirious (2001).
biography.name: Amy Stewart

biography.bio: Victor Cowie was born in 1929 in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada. He was an actor and writer, known for The Saddest Music in the World (2003), Careful (1992) and Inside Job (2003). He died on March 8, 2004 in Winnipeg.
biography.name: Victor Cowie

biography.bio: Sharon Bajer was born in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada. Her family moved throughout British Columbia before settling just outside of Vancouver where she trained as an actor at Studio 58. After graduation, Sharon moved to Winnipeg, Manitoba where she resides with her two children, Ameena and George. Aside from her experience in front of the camera, Sharon is a respected theatre artist working as an actress, playwright, director and puppeteer.
biography.name: Sharon Bajer

biography.bio: Jonathan Barrett is an actor, known for Capote (2005), Trucks (1997) and Heater (1999).
biography.name: Jonathan Barrett

biography.bio: Rick Skene was born on February 28, 1958 in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada. He is known for his work on The Lookout (2007), The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford (2007) and Curse of Chucky (2013). He has been married to Jan Skene since 1981. They have two children.
biography.name: Rick Skene

biography.bio: Don Granbery was born on March 10, 1945 in the USA. He was an assistant director and actor, known for Trucks (1997), Physical Evidence (1989) and Les sources de l'amour (1998). He died on May 31, 2007 in Texas, USA.
biography.name: Don Granbery

biography.bio: Barbara Lee Edwards is an actress, known for Trucks (1997), For the Love of My Child: The Anissa Ayala Story (1993) and L'as de la crime (1991). She has been married to Curtis Edwards since June 1994.
biography.name: Barbara Lee Edwards

biography.bio: Gene Pyrz was born on May 30, 1956. He was an actor, known for Cinderella Man (2005), Hedwig and the Angry Inch (2001) and Resident Evil: Apocalypse (2004). He died on February 25, 2014 in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada.
biography.name: Gene Pyrz

biography.bio: Kirk Harper is an actor, known for Trucks (1997).
biography.name: Kirk Harper
